title: Top 10 waterholes to cool off in this summer
text:
Top 10 waterholes to cool off in this summer Last updated 12:09, October 20 2015 Ian Brodie supplied 
Pelorus Bridge has been named by AA as one of New Zealand's best swimming spots. 
With El nino and global warming around, it's fair to say this summer is going to be a scorcher. To make sure you're not caught out in the heat, AA has released a list of top waterholes to cool you off this summer. 
KAREKARE FALLS, WAITAKERE, AUCKLAND 
Located on Auckland's wild West Coast, Karekare falls is the idea place 'get out of the city' without actually going out of the city. The waterfall is great spot for swimming and a quick walk on the Taraire Track will lead you to the top of the falls for great views. 
BULLI POINT, LAKE TAUPO 
Bring out your inner cliff diver at Bulli Point, with a range of different hights to jump into the fresh waters of Lake Taupo from. Just look out for the sign when you're on SH1 heading towards Turangi, you can't miss it. 
The Blue Spring, Putaruru. Image: Supplied 
BLUE SPRING, PUTARURU, WAIKATO 
Take the Te Waihou walkway to Blue Spring which boasts 'water so pure it supplies around 70% of New Zealand's bottled water'. Choose from the 3 hr return track when walking from the Whites Road carpark or the 30 minute return from Leslie Road carpark. 
Located midway between Blenheim and Nelson, this reserve boasts several great swimming spots dotted along it's river bank. 
RAINBOW FALLS, KERIKERI 
An easy walk through native bush leads you to the beautiful Rainbow falls. A popular spot with visitors, these falls have three viewing platforms and a large pool perfect for a swim on a hot day. 
The Rainbow Falls, Kerikeri. Image: Supplied 
MERMAID POOL, MATAPOURI, NORTHLAND 
Feel like a mermaid- or merman- in these magnificent rock pools just around the corner from Matapouri bay in Northland. The pools are replenished regularly at the high tide, just don't forget the mask and snorkel! 
MOSQUITO POINT, WHANGANUI 
Bring up memories of your childhood as you swing over this popular swimming hole on the outskirts of Whanganui. Take off from the river bank and enjoy the beautiful natural surroundings and clear echos over the river. 
KEROSENE CREEK, ROTORUA 
Sit back and relax in this thermal hot spring located between Taupu and Rotorua. The stream is nestled amongst natural bush and cascades into little pools perfect for you and your friends. 
Geothermal waterfall in kerosene creek near Rotorua New Zealand. 123RF 
CLEOPATRA'S POOL, ABEL TASMAN NATION PARK 
This beautiful rock pool comes complete with a natural, moss-lined waterslide. Located between Torrent Bay and Anchorage, the walk to Cleopatra's Pool takes approx.1hr 30mins return. 
LAKE ROTOITI, NELSON LAKES, SOUTH ISLAND 
For some serious refreshment leap of the old wooden jetty into this cold mountain lake. Lake Rotoiti is surrounded by Beech forest and is 82 metres deep. 
Do you agree with the list above? Let us know your sweet swimming spots in comments below. - Stuff
